snippet: Optimistic about a possible Supreme Court ruling against the law, lawmakers are giving past proposals a second look, with lowering health costs a priority.
abstract: Republican lawmakers are beginning to devise alternatives to Pres Obama's health care law so they can be ready if the Supreme Court strikes down any significant parts of it; they remain optimistic about the possibility of a court victory, and are giving past proposals a second look, with lowering health costs a priority.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Optimistic about a possible Supreme Court ruling against the law, lawmakers are giving past proposals a second look, with lowering health costs a priority.

headline.seo: Republicans Examine Alternatives to Obama Health Plan
headline.main: Looking Ahead, Republicans Examine Options in Health Care Fight
headline.print_headline: Looking Ahead, Republicans Examine Options in Health Care Fight
